head.title: Beth A. Lincks, Donald Maass Jr.

hedline.hl1: Beth A. Lincks, Donald Maass Jr.

block.p: Beth Arlene Lincks, the daughter of Arlie V. Lincks of Bradenton, Fla., and the late Mary Elizabeth Lincks, is to be married today to Donald W. Maass Jr., a son of Mr. Maass of Marathon, Fla., and Margery D. Maass of Orange, Conn. The Rev. Kenneth Gorsuch is to perform the ceremony at the West End Collegiate Church in New York.

The bride, who will keep her name, is a wardrobe assistant on "Saturday Night Live" at NBC-TV. She is also an actress. Ms. Lincks graduated from Rollins College and received a master's degree in fine arts from Florida State University. Her father is a professor emeritus of technology engineering at Manatee Community College in Bradenton, Fla.

Beth Arlene Lincks, the daughter of Arlie V. Lincks of Bradenton, Fla., and the late Mary Elizabeth Lincks, is to be married today to Donald W. Maass Jr., a son of Mr. Maass of Marathon, Fla., and Margery D. Maass of Orange, Conn. The Rev. Kenneth Gorsuch is to perform the ceremony at the West End Collegiate Church in New York.

The bride, who will keep her name, is a wardrobe assistant on "Saturday Night Live" at NBC-TV. She is also an actress. Ms. Lincks graduated from Rollins College and received a master's degree in fine arts from Florida State University. Her father is a professor emeritus of technology engineering at Manatee Community College in Bradenton, Fla.

Mr. Maass is a literary agent in New York and the author of a how-to guide, "The Career Novelist," to be published by Heinemann. He graduated cum laude from St. Lawrence University. His mother is an administrator at the library of the Graduate School of Forestry and Environmental Science at Yale University. His father retired as a vice president of Parametrics Inc., an electronics manufacturer in Orange.
The bridegroom's first marriage ended in divorce.
